review: This is an excellent product for customers who use Amazon Prime. If you do not use Amazon Prime, a different product would be better for you. The response time is pristine and Amazon content is easily accessible. But don't expect your iOS devices to interact well with the numerous apps which boast the ability to mirror your devices using AirPlay.Gaming:There is talk that Gamefly may start streaming game rentals to its customers and that they will use Amazon Fire exclusively. Obviously, you'll want to purchase the additional gaming controller, but even then, the games may only work with the "puck" and many games may not be compatible with the Fire TV Stick.TV Apps:If you subscribe to a cable television service, you need to make sure that your provider has a license to provide you with access to apps such as ESPN, Disney, HBO, Showtime, etc. Make a phone call for verification, because their websites may not reflect availability for the Amazon Fire. My provider, Charter, does not allow access to any of these services on the Amazon Fire even though I can access ESPN and Disney on my Apple TV. I think that Cox and SuddenLink offer access to all of them.Apple Users:Check out MacRumors to find out when the new Apple TV device is expected to be released and wait to buy that instead.
